page.title: 04ORGANIC FARMING
page.content: {The Milnes-Coates were determined to {'keep the balance of nature right', as {Lady Patricia puts it, on their farm. {No artificial fertilizers or chemicals {were used on the land.Any difficulties {they came across would be met by {either pulling up that particular crop {or fertilizing with manure. { However since her husband died Lady {Patricia has handed the running of the {farm and the estate over to an agent, {who is unusually a lady.In an effort {to make the farm more profitable, the {business of working the farm is now {the responsibility of a tenant farmer {who uses modern, non-organic methods. { In terms of livestock the farm has a {small herd of bullocks.These are put {to the slaughter regularly. { Why Moorhouse Farm? In addition {to being in a very low-lying area the {house was once in the midst of swamps.
